SENT.plain: This pilot study was initiated to show the existence of founder effects in the Dutch autosomal dominant cerebellar ataxia (ADCA) population
The ADCAs comprise a clinically heterogeneous group of neurodegenerative disorders and the estimated prevalence in the Netherlands is approximately 3:100 000 individuals
Here, we focused on the SCA3 and SCA6 genes because mutations in these genes occur most frequently in the Netherlands
We were able to determine a common origin of the CAG repeat expansions in the majority of Dutch SCA3 and SCA6 families
Haplotype analysis and linkage disequilibrium studies with polymorphic markers revealed shared haplotypes surrounding the SCA3 and SCA6 genes
These results strongly suggest that ADCA families can be traced back to common ancestors in particular parts of the Netherlands
